intro: Polyscias caroli, commonly known as the Caroline glorybower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in diameter. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by orange-red berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in coastal areas or forest undergrowth. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in tropical gardens and botanical collections.
